data.title: Meet the Lakers Joining the Womenâ€™s Volleyball Team in 2024
data.meta_description: OSWEGO, NY - The SUNY Oswego women's volleyball team is just a few weeks away from returning to campus. This will be the second season for head Coach Jon Stenman
data.text:
OSWEGO, NY - The SUNY Oswego women's volleyball team is just a few weeks away from returning to campus. This will be the second season for head Coach Jon Stenman who completed his first year with a record of 6-16. Let's take a look at the incoming class for the 2024-25 season.

Gigi Basile is a Right Side hitter from Brewerton, NY and Central Square (Paul V Moore) High School. She pllayed club for Syracuse Volleyball Club. "Gigi brings a versatile left-handed swing to our offense. She was a great multi-sport athlete at Central Square and I expect her to be an effective blocker from Day 1" Head Coach John Stenman. Gigi will wear #5.

Mya Bush is a Setter from Depew High School and Cado Volleyball Club. "Mya runs a quick offense and is able to read the defense to find the correct hitter. I have no doubt that she will quickly become one of our team leaders" Head Coach Jon Stenman. Mya will wear # 12.

Lily Byrne is a Middle Hitter from Cornwall, NY and Cornwall Central High School. She is a high school teammate of fellow newcomer Julie Santafemia. "After an excellent career in high school, I see Lily adjusting quickly to collegiate level and making an impact in the middle for us" Head Coach Jon Stenman. Lily will wear #15.

Maggie Crawford is a Setter from Baltimore, MD and Mercy High School. She played club volleyball for the Baltimore Elite Volleyball Club. "Maggie brings great athleticism to the setter position. She is very aggressive in her set selection and is not afraid to take matters into her own hands" Head Coach Jon Stenman. Maggie will wear #7.

Lauren Cropp joins us after playing a year with the Oswego State Women's Club Volleyball team. She is from Vestal High School and was a teammate of fellow Laker, Grace Gdovin. "Lauren is an active defender with steady serve receive. She will compete for the libero jersey this season" Head Coach Jon Stenman. Lauren will wear #10.

Gabby Bishop joins us after playing her first two seasons at Broome Community College. She is an outside hitter and defensive specialist from Johnson City, NY. "Gabby is a very versatile player. Despite being shorter than an average outside hitter, Gabby is explosive and has an excellent vertical. Her serving abilities will really show early in the season" Head Coach Jon Stenman. Gabby will wear #13.

Harper Phinney is a Setter from Endicott, NY and attended Union-Endicott High School. She played for Syracuse Volleyball Club last season. "Harper brings a certain grit to the setter position. She has the ability to get to balls other setters cannot. Harper is a defensive minded setter who is not afraid to hit the ground to make a play" Head Coach Jon Stenman. Harper will wear #2.

Julie Santafemia is a defensive specialist from New Windsor, NY and Cornwall Central High School. She was a high school teammate of Lily Byrne. "Julie is an aggressive defender who can cover a lot of the court defensively. With her steady defense and serve receive, I expect Julie to put herself into a position to get playing time as a freshman" Head Coach Jon Stenman. Julie will wear #1.

Priscilla McReynolds is an outside hitter from Poughkeepsie, NY and Spakenkill High School. She played for the Down State Juniors Volleyball Club. "Priscilla is an all-around, six-rotation outside hitter who keeps looking to improve her game. She has a great work ethic and has the potential to make an impact immediately" Head Coach Jon Stenman. Priscilla will wear #9.

Kalley Vugteveen joins us from Century College where she played her first two seasons. She is from Shafer, MN and is a middle hitter. "Kalley joins us from a Century team who finished 2nd in the country last season in NJCAA Division 3. I look for Kalley to use that experience and be a rock for us in the middle this season" Head Coach Jon Stenman. Kalley will wear #18.

The Lakers will have their home opener on Wednesday September 4th when they host the SUNY Poly Wildcats at 6:00 PM in the Max Ziel Gymnasium in Laker Hall.
